messages.message:
hello Cody,
QQ, I was trying to migrate some instabase clones of my fork in our AWS machines (we use them for benchmarking) but I get:
```(ib) ubuntu@ip-172-31-34-115:~/shared/benchmark_instabase/instabase$ git remote add --fetch ib-upstream-tmp git@github.com:instabase/instabase
Updating ib-upstream-tmp
ERROR: The 'instabase' organization has enabled or enforced SAML SSO.
To access this repository, you must use the HTTPS remote with a personal access token or SSH with an SSH key and passphrase that has been authorized for this organization.
Visit https://docs.github.com/articles/authenticating-to-a-github-organization-with-saml-single-sign-on/ for more information.

fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
error: Could not fetch ib-upstream-tmp```
and in general I cannot access the upstream from that machine. Is something that I am missing?
Ah, yes, you'll need to do as the error message suggest and set up an SSH key with a passphrase for accessing the upstream. Keys without a passphrase will fail.
